metadata.title: CVE-2016-7094 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in Xen 4.7.x and earlier allows local x86 HVM guest OSadministrators on guests running with shadow paging to cause a denial ofservice via a pagetable update.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7094` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xen-utils-common - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
xenstore-utils - 4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.2-0ubuntu0.14.04.7').
